results.title: English Language Specialist Program | Exchange Programs
results.content: Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs Exchange Programs. # English Language Specialist Program. English Language Specialists are top-tier experts in the field of Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) with an MA or Ph.D. in TESOL, Applied Linguistics, or a related field who lead intensive, high-level English language projects. Specialist projects may be in-country or virtual. English Language Specialists assist U.S. Embassies in delivering and maintaining quality English language programs overseas and promoting mutual understanding between the U.S. and other countries. U.S. Embassies identify and define the English Language Specialist assignments, which may include teacher training, curriculum, and textbook development, ESP (English for Specific Purposes) skills development, delivering conference plenary addresses, or online course development. There is no direct English language teaching. Learn how to apply on the English Language Specialist website. ### Program Length. Learn more at the English Language Programs website. ### Program Profile. ### Related Programs. #### Find more programs. ### Recently Viewed Programs. ### Search our Exchange Programs.
